snippet: Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi would extend Iran’s influence over the Iraqi people and Shiite Muslims everywhere if he were to succeed Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani.
abstract: Iran is positioning hard-line cleric Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi to succeed 81-year-old Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani of Iraq, the spiritual leader of the Shiite Muslim world; succession battle has profound implications for all Shiite Muslims and for the role of democracy in the Islamic world; Iran would forcefully expand its influence over Iraq should Shahroudi prove successful.
lead_paragraph: Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi would extend Iran’s influence over the Iraqi people and Shiite Muslims everywhere if he were to succeed Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani.

headline.seo: Iran Promotes Its Candidate for Next Shiite Leader
headline.main: Iran Presses for Official to Be Next Leader of Shiites
headline.print_headline: Iran Is Pressing For Top Official As Shiite Leader
